Name: Reporting of crash data involving taxi and limousine commission licensed vehicles.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reporting of crash data involving taxi and limousine commission licensed vehicles.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: Bill not signed at 6-11-2014 hearing;  scheduled hearing for 6-13-2014 did not take place.

History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1.  Chapter five of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-542 to read as follows:
      �19-542  Reporting of crash data on commission licensed vehicles.  On or before February 1, 2015 and quarterly thereafter, the commission shall for the prior quarter provide a report to the council and shall post on its website, the number of crashes involving a vehicle licensed by the commission.  Such report shall disaggregate such crashes by the type of commission licensed vehicle and by whether critical injury or death resulted from such crashes.  The commission shall also maintain within its records the number of crashes each licensed driver has been involved in while operating a commission licensed vehicle.  For purposes of this section, "critical injury" shall mean any injury determined to be critical by the emergency medical service personnel responding to any such incident.

      �2. This local law shall take effect immediately upon enactment into law.
